description: President Donald Trump renewed criticism of Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell as he championed his economic policies and tariff regime during an event on Tuesday to mark his 100th day in office.
title: Trump Bashes Powell, Touts Tariffs at 100 Day Rally in Michigan

description: Chile’s central bank kept its key interest rate unchanged for the third straight meeting, citing the global turmoil triggered by President Donald Trump’s trade tariffs and “elevated” inflation.
title: Chile Keeps Rates at 5% on Threats From Inflation and Growth

description: El Salvador is still purchasing Bitcoin even after inking a loan agreement with International Monetary Fund that required it to stop accumulating the token.
title: El Salvador Says It’s Still Buying Bitcoin After IMF Accord

description: Former second gentleman Doug Emhoff said he has been removed from his post at the United States Holocaust Memorial Council, the board that oversees the museum documenting the Nazi genocide of Jews and other minorities during World War II.
title: Emhoff Says He’s Been Removed From US Holocaust Museum Board

description: McDonald’s Corp. and Coca-Cola Co. said they continue to see risks to operating in Russia, a signal that major US firms remain cautious about business investments in the country.
title: McDonald’s, Coca-Cola Still See Risks to Operating in Russia

description: Florida’s legislature passed a law banning fluoride in drinking water, a move that advances growing skepticism among conservative lawmakers towards long-accepted dental hygiene.
title: Florida to Ban Fluoride From Drinking Water, Advancing RFK Cause

description: President Donald Trump said China deserved the steep tariffs he imposed on their exports and predicted Beijing could find a way to reduce their impact on American consumers.
title: Trump Predicts China Would ‘Eat’ Tariffs, Lessening US Impact

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Stephanie Lai looks at how the president’s first 100 days could set the tone for the rest of his term. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s 100 Days Sets Up Next Test for His Agenda

description: US forces have struck more than 1,000 targets in President Donald Trump’s campaign against Houthi militants in Yemen, the Pentagon said, offering rare insight into a stepped-up offensive that’s been conducted largely in secret.
title: US Has Struck 1,000 Houthi Targets Under Trump, Pentagon Says

description: President Donald Trump signed an executive order easing the impact of his auto tariffs, yielding to weeks of intense lobbying from automakers, parts suppliers and car dealers who warned excessive levies could push up car prices, triggering plant shutdowns and job losses.
title: Trump Signs Order to Prevent His Auto Tariffs From Stacking on Top of Each Other

description: Shortly after welcoming new members to the club, the BRICS bloc of nations is suffering from the same problem dogging other global multilateral institutions: Its members can’t agree on key issues.
title: BRICS Rift Emerges in Rio as New Members Balk at Past Agreements

description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney won election Monday by promising to manage a mercurial US president bent on waging a global trade war.
title: Carney’s Plan to Manage Trump: Keep Calm, Find New Friends

description: Harvard University released its long-awaited reports on antisemitism and anti-Muslim bias, presenting a scathing critique of how its students treated each other in the aftermath of the Hamas attack against Israel on Oct. 7, 2023.
title: Harvard’s President Says ‘I’m Sorry’ After Reports on Bias

description: Donald Trump is “confident” a deal on critical minerals will be signed with Ukraine, the White House said, a move that could bolster US support for Kyiv as the US president grows frustrated over delays in clinching a ceasefire in Russia’s war on Ukraine.
title: Trump’s Confident He’ll Sign Ukraine Minerals Deal, Leavitt Says

description: Republican lawmakers pushing for the expansion of the state and local tax deduction in President Donald Trump’s economic package are slated to meet with House Speaker Mike Johnson, Representative Young Kim said.
title: Pro-SALT Deduction Republicans to Meet with Johnson on Tax Bill

description: Ghana has arrested three Indian nationals for allegedly smuggling gold out of the West African nation for the past decade.
title: Ghana Arrests Three Indian Nationals Suspected of Smuggling Gold

description: Squabbles between Spain’s minority government and opposition parties are muddling efforts to find out and explain what caused a massive blackout that left Spain, Portugal and parts of France in the dark on Monday.
title: Spain’s Toxic Politics Clouds Investigation Into Power Blackout

description: The Pentagon needs to get more weapons faster, make it easier for companies to work with the government and ensure national security is funded sufficiently and consistently, according to President Donald Trump’s nominee for assistant secretary of defense for industrial base policy.
title: Pentagon Nominee Pledges to Strengthen the US Industrial Base

description: The US imposed sanctions on six companies based in Iran and China for their alleged role in securing ingredients for Tehran’s ballistic missiles, ramping up pressure on Tehran even as the Trump administration seeks a new deal to limit its nuclear program.
title: US Sanctions Six Firms in Iran and China Linked to Missile Program

description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth announced Tuesday that he was ending Pentagon participation in an initiative on women and conflict that President Donald Trump signed into law during his first term with backing from prominent members of the current administration.
title: Hegseth Slams Law on Women in Conflict Signed by Trump

description: India’s military can decide on the response to the killing of 26 people in the Himalayan region of Kashmir last week, the Economic Times newspaper reported on Tuesday.
title: India’s Military to Decide on Response to Killings, Report Says

description: The real estate industry is at the forefront of a lobbying blitz to sway Congress to preserve the carried interest tax break that President Donald Trump wants to abolish in a giant tax bill pending in Congress.
title: Real Estate Firms Push to Preserve Carried Interest Tax Break

description: Alberta’s Premier Danielle Smith pledged to stand up to Ottawa after the Liberal Party’s fourth consecutive election victory in Canada, saying she would not allow the “status quo” between the oil-rich province and the federal government to continue.
title: Leader of Oil-Rich Alberta Strikes Defiant Tone After Liberal Election Win

description: President Vladimir Putin is insisting that Russia must take control of four regions of Ukraine it doesn’t fully occupy as part of any agreement to end his war, according to three people in Moscow familiar with the matter.
title: Putin Is Said to Keep Demanding Ukraine Land Despite US Pressure

description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said the European Union has some “internal matters” to sort out before the bloc can enter into trade negotiations with the US, singling out a tax on digital services levied by some countries.
title: Bessent Cites Digital Services Tax as Sticking Point in EU Talks

description: Trinidad and Tobago’s opposition swept to power in a landslide victory that marks a stunning comeback for Prime Minister Kamla Persad-Bissessar, who had led the country between 2010 and 2015.
title: Trinidad’s Persad-Bissessar Recovers Power in Landslide Win

description: The White House denounced Amazon.com Inc’s reported move to display the cost of President Donald Trump’s tariffs on products, setting the stage for a high-profile clash between the administration and the popular online marketplace.
title: White House Says Amazon ‘Hostile’ for Reported Tariff Labels

description: Ivory Coast’s main opposition party appealed a court ruling that disqualified former Credit Suisse Chief Executive Officer Tidjane Thiam from running in this year’s presidential election.
title: Ex-Credit Suisse CEO Thiam Fights Ivory Coast Vote Ban in Court

description: When Donald Trump was sworn in as the 47th US president, he proclaimed the dawning of a new “Golden Age.”
title: From Stocks to Dollar, Trump’s ‘Golden Age’ Is Off to Ugly Start

description: Fewer Finns have faith in NATO’s security guarantees after President Donald Trump cast doubt over whether the US would unconditionally defend allies in the event of an attack, according to a recent poll.
title: Finns Turn More Negative on NATO Security Guarantees, Poll Shows

description: The Manhattan-sized plot of land in Norway’s archipelago stirs national security worries.
title: Controversial Arctic Parcel of Land May Sell for €300 Million

description: India signaled the possibility of “early mutual wins” in its negotiations with the US, as the two nations inch closer to sealing the first tranche of a trade deal by fall of this year.
title: India Eyes ‘Early Mutual Wins’ in US Bilateral Trade Talks

description: The Philippines and Japan plan to expand their security partnership, their leaders said, as both countries grapple with maritime disputes with China.
title: Japan, Philippines Plan More Security Deals Amid China Tensions

description: Sanctioned tankers return to work after lying idle for months
title: Russia’s Oil Exports Edge Higher With Return of Sanctioned Ships

description: President Xi Jinping’s diplomats are fanning out across the world with a clear message for countries cutting deals with Donald Trump: The US is a bully that can’t be trusted.
title: Xi Is Trying to Turn World Against US as Trump Cuts Trade Deals

description: Germany’s acting Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock said on Tuesday that the disputed Nord Stream gas pipeline shouldn’t be reactivated, amid suggestions that a potential ceasefire in Ukraine could lead to renewed deliveries from Russia.
title: Germany’s Baerbock Warns Against Nord Stream Reopening

description: A Latin term that used to be little-known outside the world of customs brokers has become the stuff of headlines. That’s thanks to a decision by US President Donald Trump to close a tariff loophole for “de minimis” merchandise from mainland China and Hong Kong starting May 2.
title: What’s the De Minimis Tariff Loophole Trump Is Closing?

description: Tesla paid the price for its CEO’s unprecedented side gig slashing federal bureaucracy under Trump.
title: As Musk Nears End of 130-Day DOGE Stint, He's $113 Billion Down

description: Benin is headed for its deadliest month of Islamist violence since militants linked to al-Qaeda began making inroads in the West African country in 2021.
title: Jihadist Attacks Put Benin on Track for Deadliest Month

description: The Central Intelligence Agency won’t acknowledge whether it runs a secret northern Virginia complex that appeared briefly on a list of “non-core” federal properties that the Trump administration tried to sell last month.
title: CIA Won’t Say Whether It Operates Facility Trump Tried to Sell

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Trump Effect Propels Carney to Comeback Win in Canada

description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated Mark Carney for his Liberal Party’s victory in Canada’s national election, pointing to the prospect of a further thaw in relations between the two countries.
title: Modi Congratulates Carney on Canada Election Win as Tensions Ease

description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa has agreed to establish a commission of inquiry into alleged political interference in the prosecution of crimes committed during the apartheid era by security forces.
title: Ramaphosa Agrees to Establish Commission Into Apartheid Crimes

description: Companies around the world including carmakers, brewers, airlines and packaged food makers are sounding a warning that US President Donald Trump’s import tariffs are beginning to wreak havoc on their businesses.
title: From Porsche to Carlsberg and JetBlue, Tariff Toll Spreads

description: France is pushing to slap fees on small packages from discount Chinese retailers including Temu and Shein Group Ltd. in an effort to stem a flow that risks accelerating as the US implements sweeping tariffs.
title: France Seeks Fees on Small Parcels After Flows From China Surge

description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre is projected to lose his own seat in the Canadian election, despite delivering the best result for his party since 2011.
title: Canada’s Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre Loses His Own Seat in Election, CBC Projects

description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth has promised to produce a first-ever “clean” audit of the Pentagon by 2028, but the F-35, the costliest US weapons system, poses one of the biggest obstacles.
title: F-35’s Inventory Failings Are Issue in Pentagon’s Audit Failure

description: President Donald Trump is finally getting on the road to promote his agenda, after spending much of his first 100 days in office ensconced in the White House or his private clubs.
title: Trump Is Finally Coming Face to Face With Voters After Approval Rating Falls

description: Hungary approved legislation that allows authorities to strip European Parliament lawmakers of their mandate, a move seen by critics of Prime Minister Viktor Orban as an attempt to potentially sideline his poll-leading rival before next year’s election.
title: Orban Moves to Sideline His Election Rival With New Hungary Law

description: Malta’s “golden passports” program for wealthy investors violates European Union rules on citizenship, the bloc’s top court ruled in a case that could have transformed the EU into a haven for affluent foreigners at a time when President Donald Trump wants to entice them to the US.
title: EU Bans Sale of ‘Golden Passports’ as Trump Opens Doors

description: Pakistan’s army said it shot down an Indian spy drone along their disputed border in the Kashmir region, as tensions rise over last week’s militant attacks that killed 26 people.
title: Pakistan Says It Shot Down an Indian Spy Drone in Kashmir

description: The Philippine government plans to sell some of its rice inventories at heavily subsidized prices in May as residents in the Asian archipelago turn out for midterm elections.
title: Philippines Plans to Start Subsidized Rice Sales in May

description: Canada’s Liberal Party held onto crucial ground in the Toronto and Montreal regions, helping secure a path for Mark Carney to remain prime minister even as support slipped from the last federal election.
title: Carney’s Narrow Victory Buoyed by Voters in Toronto, Montreal

description: Spain and Portugal were returning to some semblance of normality early Tuesday, with many questions remaining about what caused one of Europe’s worst blackouts in years across the Iberian peninsula the previous day.
title: Spain Slowly Returning to Normal After Crippling Blackout

description: The UK is considering scaling back its nearly £2 billion ($2.7 billion) commitment to a World Bank fund for developing nations, according to people familiar with official plans, in a move that could see it slash aid alongside Donald Trump’s White House.
title: UK Considers Breaking £2 Billion Aid Promise to the World Bank

description: China is willing to support normal cooperation between US companies, the country’s Ministry of Commerce said in a statement Tuesday, just days after Chinese airlines rejected taking delivery of any new jets from US planemaker Boeing Co.
title: China Says Willing to Cooperate With US Firms After Boeing Spat

description: Canada’s dollar rose against the greenback as Mark Carney was projected to win in the election, keeping the former central banker in the Prime Minister role and his Liberal Party in power.
title: Canadian Dollar Edges Higher as Carney’s Liberals Win Election

description: Canada’s Liberal Party is projected to win a fourth consecutive election, giving a mandate to former central banker Mark Carney after a campaign in which he pledged to boost economic growth and stand up to US President Donald Trump in a trade war.
title: Carney’s Liberals Set to Win Narrow Victory in Canada Vote

description: On Good Friday, an aging supertanker fully laden with oil and calling itself Varada arrived in the waters to the east of Malaysia after a two-month voyage from Venezuela.
title: Zombie Ships Are Fast Becoming a Feature of Venezuelan Oil Trade

description: Asian countries should diversify their trading partners and boost domestic demand to ensure they can ride out the current global trade war, the head of the Asian Development Bank said.
title: Tariff War Shows Asian Nations Need New Trade Partners: ADB Head

description: China’s top diplomat warned countries against caving into US tariff threats, as the Trump administration hints at the possible use of new trade tools to pressure Beijing.
title: China Vows to Stand Firm, Urges Nations to Resist ‘Bully’ Trump

description: US President Donald Trump’s tariffs could push Asian nations closer to China and destabilize regional security, Japan’s ruling party policy chief warned, calling for stronger defense ties between Washington and Tokyo.
title: Japan Worries Trump Tariffs Will Push Countries Toward China

description: President Donald Trump is on track to ease the impact of his auto tariffs, with changes sought by the industry that would lift some levies on foreign parts for cars and trucks made inside the US.
title: Trump to Offer Auto Tariffs Reprieve After Carmaker Appeals
